briefTitle: Study Comparing Rifaximin With Xifaxan 200 mg in Traveler's Diarrhea
officialTitle: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel Design, Multicenter, Bioequivalence Study With Clinical Endpoint Comparing Rifaximin 200-mg Tablets With Xifaxan® 200-mg Tablets in the Treatment of Travelers' Diarrhea
summary: The primary objective is to demonstrate rifaximin 200 milligrams (mg) tablets (test) and Xifaxan® 200 mg tablets (reference) are clinically bioequivalent with respect to the clinical cure rates when administered 3 times a day (TID) for 3 days in participants with travelers' diarrhea.

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Achieved Clinical Cure at Test of Cure (TOC) Visit (Within 24 to 72 Hours From the Time of Last Dose): Per-Protocol (PP) Population
